data.title: FUN THINGS TO DO WITH KIDS IN METRO DETROIT THIS WEEKEND
data.text:
Start planning a weekend full of family fun with the top kid-friendly things to do in Metro Detroit this weekend!

Start Making Plans: Go NEXT LEVEL In Downtown Detroit

GIVEAWAY: Mother’s Day Giveaway: The Lip Bar

NOW OPEN:C.J. Barrymore’s $3M ‘Mario Kart’ Track Grand Opening

Summer Adventures: Walk, Ride or Play Along Hines Drive On Saturdays

Dive In: Goldfish Swim School Offers FREE lessons for Babies Up To 6 Months

ANNOUNCED: LittleGuide Detroit Teams Up With Children’s Hospital of Michigan for FREE Family Safety Day This Summer

FREE First Friday @ Cranbrook Institute of Science

When: Friday, May 3rd

Where: Cranbrook Institute of Science

Enjoy free admission to Cranbrook Science on Friday from 10am to 10pm.

LAST CHANCE: DeBuck’s Tulip Festival

When: Friday – Sunday

Where: DeBuck’s Family Farm

Stroll the vibrant, butterfly shaped tulip fields at DeBuck’s Family Farm this spring. In addition to the tulip fields, families can also enjoy a dozen other outdoor activities: Wagon Rides, pedal cars, giant slide, giant corn hole, playgrounds and more. After you’re done with the activities stop by one of DeBuck’s food stands for tasty treats including donuts, kettle corn, cotton candy, funnel cakes, and much more.

Grand Rapids Lantern Festival

When: Friday – Sunday

Where: John Ball Zoo, Grand Rapids

John Ball Zoo is a gem and during the Lantern Festival it glows. The lantern festival features handcrafted Asian lantern displays that illuminate a pathway through the entire zoo, telling the intersecting story of wildlife and Asian culture. Throughout the walk you can stop to get photos with displays (including Chinese Zodiac sign and angel wings), stop for bubble fun, sneak off to the illuminated play area and more.

Shelby Township Lions Club Carnival

When: Friday – Sunday

Where: Lakeside Mall, Sterling Heights

Dive into thrilling games and activities on the Midway, and make sure to leave a little tummy space for the feast… Fried dough, juicy sausages, mouthwatering funnel cakes, crispy corn dogs, candy apples, ice cream, and a whole lot of yummy goodness awaits.

FUNBOX Bounce House

When: Friday – Sunday

Where: Oakland Mall, Troy

FUNBOX® is a 20,000 sq ft inflatable playground with 10 thrilling play zones, including the Tumble Temple, Marshmallow Mountain, Gumball’s Gallop, and an exciting obstacle course that will have you bouncing with excitement.

Dino & Dragon Stroll

When: Friday – Sunday

Where: Canterbury Village, Lake Orion

Dinosaurs and dragons are back at Canterbury Village for weekend fun in May. Find life-size dinosaurs, interact with baby dinos and smoke-breathing dragons. Every weekend will have a unique theme with bonus fun.

ANNIE: The Musical

When: Friday – Sunday

Where: Fox Theatre, Detroit

Little Orphan Annie has reminded generations of theatergoers that sunshine is always right around the corner, and now the best-loved musical of all time is set to return in a new production. Introduce your kids to the sights and sounds of one of America’s most beloved stage production.

A Day Out With Thomas

When: Saturday & Sunday

Where: Greenfield Village, Dearborn

op aboard an interactive train ride on Thomas, say hello to Sir Topham Hatt™ and get poppin’ with special activities in the Bubble Zone. Experience wide-eyed, memory-making moments on a springtime adventure in Greenfield Village, including storytelling, play areas, lawn games, photo ops, bubble-blowing zones, live music and more. Admission to Day Out With Thomas includes a timed ticket to ride on Thomas the Tank Engine and themed programming for your littlest engineer — plus, all-day access to Greenfield Village for over 80 acres of inspiration. A Day Out With Thomas activities are happening May 4th, 5th, 11th, 12th, 18th and 19th.

FREE Mini-Train Rides

When: Saturday & Sunday

Where: Starr Jaycee Park, Royal Oak

Great Lakes Live Steamers run miniature train rides from 12pm to 4pm the first weekend each month at Starr Jaycee Park in Royal Oak. The rides are complimentary but donations are appreciated.

Cranbrook On The Green

When: Saturday & Sunday

Where: Cranbrook Art Museum, Bloomfield Hills

Sink a putt at ten custom-designed, art-inspired holes on the beautiful grounds of Cranbrook Art Museum next to the Knoll Walkway and Triton Pool. Tickets include museum admission.

May The 4th Be With You

When: Saturday, May 4th

Where: Howell Nature Center

Journey to a distant galaxy and join fellow enthusiasts for an unforgettable Star Wars nature experience! Don your favorite character’s attire and immerse yourself in the universe we all adore.

Train Day

When: Saturday, May 4th

Where: DNR Outdoor Adventure Center, Detroit

Train Day includes interactive activities, such as an inflatable train to crawl through and a trackless train to ride on (weather permitting), a model railroad, guest speaker, railroading artifacts and more! Outdoor activities free; indoor activities free with building admission.

Sturgeon Day Celebration

When: Saturday, May 4th

Where: Milliken State Park, Detroit

Come and see the amazing Lake Sturgeon up close and personal during Sturgeon Day at Milliken State Park! Join the Detroit River International Wildlife Refuge and the Detroit Riverfront Conservancy as we partner together to celebrate all things sturgeon.

Fishing Derby

When: Saturday, May 4th

Where: Heritage Park, Canton

One of Canton’s longest-running traditions returns! Join us at the ponds of Heritage Park for this family-friendly event. Please bring your own fishing gear, worms will be available for purchase, while supplies last. Only those who will be fishing need to purchase a ticket.

FREE Admission at Detroit Historical Museum

When: Saturday, May 4th

Where: Detroit Historical Museum, Detroit

Celebrate the new exhibition Kresge at 100: A Century of Impact, a Future of Opportunity with free admission to the Detroit Historical Museum from 10am to 5pm.

FREE Lowes Workshop

When: Saturday, May 4th

Where: Lowes, multiple locations

Join Lowes once a month for a fun kids workshop! Available at most locations.

Opening Day Birmingham Farmers Market

When: Sunday, May 5th

Where: Downtown Birmingham

Birmingham Farmers Market Opening Day Celebration includes live music, food trucks, a kids’ zone and other festivities! Every Sunday, May 5 through October 27, shop over 50 local vendors, listen to live music and enjoy kids activities. The market hosts a variety of special events monthly throughout the season, with face painting, petting farms, fitness activities and more!

Kid’s Day at Michigan Panthers Home Game

When: Sunday, May 5th

Where: Ford Field, Detroit

Michigan Panthers are celebrating all Kids! Kickoff is at 1pm but the doors at Ford Field open at 12pm. Arrive early and visit the Kids Zone at Gate G before the game to meet Pablo the Panther, receive your First Game Certificate and make a cheer sign for the team!

Hanami Spring Picnic

When: Sunday, May 5th

Where: MSU Tollgate Farm, Novi

Hanami Spring Picnic is a celebration of the blossoming of the farms ornamental cherry trees and Japanese culture! Join us for music, kids activities, and casual picnicking in the Sakura Garden. Guests can bring their own picnic lunch or purchase items from our concession stand.

Dog-Man The Musical

When: Sunday, May 5th

Where: Michigan Theater, Ann Arbor

Dog Man: The Musical is a hilarious production based on the worldwide bestselling series from Dav Pilkey, the creator of Captain Underpants and Cat Kid Comic Club.
